title: waterfall plot cannot plot shap values from estimators
body:
Much of the plotting in v 0.40.0 appears to be broken. For example, generating shap values from an XGBoost model:

```python
explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(boosted_regmod)
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X_test)
```

Attempting to plot any of these results in an attribute error:

```python
>>> shap.waterfall_plot(shap_values[0])

AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
/tmp/ipykernel_10638/1086002471.py in <module>
----> 1 shap.waterfall_plot(shap_values[10])

~/miniforge3/envs/bios8366/lib/python3.9/site-packages/shap/plots/_waterfall.py in waterfall(shap_values, max_display, show)
     44 
     45 
---> 46     base_values = shap_values.base_values
     47 
     48     features = shap_values.data

AttributeError: 'numpy.ndarray' object has no attribute 'base_values'
```

Similarly,

```
>>> shap.plots.beeswarm(shap_values)

UnboundLocalError                         Traceback (most recent call last)
/tmp/ipykernel_10638/2931622918.py in <module>
----> 1 shap.plots.beeswarm(shap_values)

~/miniforge3/envs/bios8366/lib/python3.9/site-packages/shap/plots/_beeswarm.py in beeswarm(shap_values, max_display, order, clustering, cluster_threshold, color, axis_color, alpha, show, log_scale, color_bar, plot_size, color_bar_label)
     65         #     out_names = shap_exp.output_names
     66 
---> 67     order = convert_ordering(order, values)
     68 
     69 

UnboundLocalError: local variable 'values' referenced before assignment
```

Why are numpy arrays being returned from `explainer.shap_values()` when the plotting functions don't expect numpy arrays?
